page.title: 08FUND RAISING AT GOOSE GREEN
page.content: Crowds attended a Vintage Car & Motor Cycle Rally at The Huntsman Public House at Goose Green on Sunday 15th Sept.85. The vehicles,parked in the Beer Garden by the duckpond,were much admired. All pre-1930 & all lovingly restored & maintained by their owners: Bentleys,a Humber,Lagonda,Morris Cowleys & motor cycles too. Hamburgers & sausages were sold at the outdoor barbeque,raffle tickets too. All this to raise funds for the Guide Dogs for the Blind, the publican's pet charity. During the 5 years he has been at this traditional country pub in its beautiful woodland setting, customers have enthusiastically supported many fund raising events for this Charity. 2 photos of Guide dogs funded by The Huntsman are on display in the oak- beamed bar. After this Rally it is hoped there will soon be a third!
